text: Margaret Nixon "Marni" McEathron (February 22, 1930 â€“ July 24, 2016), known professionally as Marni Nixon, was an American singer and actress in movie musicals. She was best known for dubbing the singing voices of the leading actresses in movies, including The King and I, West Side Story, and My Fair Lady.Fox, Margalit. "Marni Nixon, the Singing Voice Behind the Screen, Dies at 86", The New York Times, July 25, 2016 ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website * * * Extensive Nixon biography and photos * Interview with Marni Nixon by Bruce Duffie, June 10, 1987 * Nixon singing with Leonard Bernstein on television in 1961 Category:1930 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from breast cancer Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American voice actors Category:American musical theatre actors Category:Singers from Los Angeles County, California Category:Actors from Los Angeles County, California
title: Marni Nixon
